trial_identification.studytitle: Effectiveness of training somatosensation in the hand after stroke: A randomized controlled trial.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effectiveness of training somatosensation in the hand after stroke: A randomized controlled trial.

interventions.interventions: The experimental intervention (EI) will comprise 10 sessions of generalized discrimination training of texture discrimination, limb position sense and tactual object recognition. Sessions are 60-90 minutes duration and are conducted 3 times per week. Group A will receive two phases of EI. Group B will receive one phase of CI followed by one phase of EI.
interventions.comparator: The control intervention (CI) will comprise 10 sessions of exposure to sensory stimuli.

primaryOutcome.outcome: A multi-scale score of sensory discrimination performance based on improvement in the discrimination of functionally relevant sensory stimuli, i.e. texture discrimination, limb position sense and tactual object recognition.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome assessments will be conducted at baseline, just prior to the commencement of the initial phase, and at the end of phase two. Follow-up assessments will be conducted at 6 weeks and 6 months post training to determine maintenance of training effects. Between-group comparison of intervention effect will be conducted at the end of phase one. Within-group comparison of intervention effect will compare change during EI with preceding change during CI.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Hand function in self-care activities (measured using the Sequential Occupational Dexterity Assessment).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome assessments will be conducted at baseline, just prior to the commencement of the initial phase, and at the end of phase two. Follow-up assessments will be conducted at 6 weeks and 6 months post training to determine maintenance of training effects. Between-group comparison of intervention effect will be conducted at the end of phase one. Within-group comparison of intervention effect will compare change during EI with preceding change during CI.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Actual use of the upper limb in life situations will be measured using the Upper Extremity Motor Activity Log (UE/MAL).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: These measures will be administered at the same time points as for the primary outcome measures.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The Barthel Index (BI) will also be employed as a secondary measure to provide a more global disability measure of performance in daily self-care activities.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: These measures will be administered at the same time points as for the primary outcome measures.

trial_design.concealment: Centralised randomisation with the person assigning the subjects different to the executor of the assignment. Allocation is communicated via sealed, opaque envelopes and/or confidential email.
trial_design.sequence: Sequence generation using computer random number generator with matching constraints.
trial_design.designfeatures: Group A: E1, E1 and Group B: C1, E1
